comments:
i200411050810

Open a class in the Java editor. Using the package explorer, I moved it from its
original package to another package. The Move dialog appeared asking if I wanted
to update references (yes), see a preview (no). The operation failed with lots
of SWTExceptions/assertion failures, seeming to be caused by calls made by the
Java editor. The Move dialog was still open in the end. The editor would not
redraw anymore. 

Will attach the log. Here is the exception that started it all:

Forgot to mention: I could not reproduce this afterwards.

Do use editor re-use? Was the editor dirty?

Strange. Both beginCompoundChange and endCompoundChange call commit which can
cause the NPE. However, the NPE only gets triggered by endCompoundChange. The
only way (except for VM JIT bugs) for DefaultUndoManager.fPreviousDelete to be
null is when connect(...) never was called or with a null argument. The
null-argument case can be ruled out here since we call it from the TextViewer
with this as argument.

It looks as if TextViewer.RewriteTarget.endCompoundchange was notified before
its undo manager got connected. But then, why didn't beginCompoundChange trigger
the NPE?
*** Bug 78517 has been marked as a duplicate of this bug. ***

Steps in I200411240800 + zrh-plugins from 20041130_0923 + jdt.core from HEAD:
- new workspace, new java project, open new CU C.java
- make editor dirty
- Refactor > Rename C.java
- accept save all
- enter new name "D" and press OK

=> "Exception when synchronizing" from bug 79755
=> NPE below
- press Cancel
-> Editor stays open with C.java. On activation, it shows a "File Deleted" dialog.

The NPE is a follow-up of an exception in configure(...).
In Markus' case the real cause was bug 79755.

In this bug setTab failed for a not yet known reason. We now protected the undo
manager. Adapting summary and reducing severity to normal.
*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 53641 ***
